boat.name: Codling
boat.full_description:
Codling, built as a Freedom 21 in 1987, is derived from the catboats originally built to fish the shallow waters off Cape Cod from about 1840. The cat rig has a single unstayed mast stepped well forward, and is sailed upwind with mainsail only. In 1853 one of the early racing boats with the cat rig was shipped to Cowes from the USA, and raced very successfully. Her name was Una and she gave her name to this rig in English waters - the Una-rig

A retractable bowsprit was fitted in 2009 to enable downwind sails to be carried - an asymmetric spinnaker or a roller-furling code zero.

In the OGA 55 race on 18 August 2018 she finished Class 3 under 23' waterline - First on elapsed time, and First corrected time.

Overall - Fifth boat on the water, and second overall on corrected time.

For 2019 the gaff and topmast, previously made from aluminium alloy have been replaced by new spars of carbon fibre.

Solent Gaffers race 2019, Cowes to Lymington - second on the water to Rosenn, but first overall on corrected time.
boat.short_description: Codling is an unstayed catboat, fitted with bowsprit. Her design is after the racing catboats of the 1840s.
